Button

Buttons are used to trigger actions or events.

<button class="btn">Default Button</button>

Usage

Buttons are used to trigger actions or events, such as submitting a form, opening a dialog, canceling an action, or performing a delete operation.

When to use

  • Use buttons to trigger an action or event.
  • Use links to navigate to a different page or location within the page.

Implementation

<button class="btn">Button Text</button>

Available modifiers

  • btn-secondary: Secondary button style
  • btn-outline: Outline button style
  • btn-danger: Danger/delete button style
  • btn-success: Success/confirm button style
  • btn-sm: Small button
  • btn-lg: Large button
  • btn-block: Full-width button

Parameters

Parameter Type Description
text String The button text (required)
modifier String CSS class modifiers (optional)
disabled Boolean Whether the button is disabled (optional)
type String Button type attribute (default: "button")
iconLeft HTML Icon to display before text (optional)
iconRight HTML Icon to display after text (optional)

Variations

<button class="btn btn-secondary">Secondary Button</button>

<button class="btn btn-outline">Outline Button</button>
